meanings.definition: Exchange goods or services for other goods or services without using money.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys bartering her toys with her friends.
meanings.sent2: In the past, people used to barter for food and clothes.
meanings.sent3: The kids were bartering their snacks during lunchtime.
meanings.sent4: Bartering ideas in a brainstorming session can lead to creative solutions.
meanings.sent5: Bartering can be a fun way to trade items you no longer need.

meanings.definition: Negotiate the terms of a trade without involving money.
meanings.sent1: They are bartering the price of the car before making a deal.
meanings.sent2: Bartering for a better price is common in some markets.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were bartering chores to avoid doing their least favorite tasks.
meanings.sent4: Bartering for time off work can sometimes be challenging.
meanings.sent5: Bartering skills can come in handy when trying to reach a compromise.
